title: Implement witness query/last/count subcommands and filter semantics
description:
Implement witness query/last/count subcommands with documented filters and output modes.

These commands provide read/query access to the witness ledger without mutation.
design:
- Add filtering by tool/since/until/outcome/input-hash with optional limit.
- Implement `last` and `count` semantics with text/json modes.
- Enforce no-match and error exit semantics per witness conventions.
acceptance_criteria:
- query/last/count all function and return deterministic data.
- No-match and malformed ledger behavior match documented exit codes.
- Subcommands do not mutate ledger state.

title: Implement run orchestration flow and exit-code semantics
description:
Implement core run orchestration and exit-code semantics for the main lock command.

This bead coordinates parse/validate/build/emit paths and refusal wiring; witness append behavior is handled separately.
design:
- Sequence: parse CLI, handle describe/schema/witness subcommand dispatch, ingest, validate, build, emit.
- Enforce exit semantics: 0 LOCK_CREATED, 1 LOCK_PARTIAL, 2 REFUSAL/CLI errors.
- Integrate refusal model/envelope decisions without duplicating witness append logic.
acceptance_criteria:
- Orchestration path matches PLAN execution flow (excluding witness append specifics).
- Exit codes are stable across LOCK_CREATED/LOCK_PARTIAL/REFUSAL and parse errors.
- Refusal integration is deterministic and testable.

title: Release parity: artifact matrix + checksums + signatures + SBOM + provenance
description:
Implement rvl-grade release artifact infrastructure for lock.

Design:
- Build and package release binaries for linux/macos/windows targets in workflow matrix.
- Publish versioned archives plus SHA256SUMS.
- Sign release checksums and emit verifiable signature/certificate artifacts.
- Generate SBOM and provenance artifacts and attach all outputs to GitHub release.

Acceptance criteria:
- release workflow emits multi-target archives and uploads them to GitHub Releases.
- SHA256SUMS + signature/certificate are produced and published.
- SBOM + provenance artifacts are generated and published.
- Workflow is idempotent on reruns (safe when tag/release already exists).
close_reason:
Release workflow enhanced with all acceptance criteria:
1. Multi-target build matrix (5 targets: x86_64-linux, aarch64-linux, x86_64-macos, aarch64-macos, x86_64-windows)
2. SHA256SUMS + cosign keyless signature/certificate
3. CycloneDX SBOM + GitHub build provenance attestation
4. Idempotent on reruns (tag/release reuse, --clobber uploads)
Quality gate: fmt clean, clippy clean, 198 tests pass. YAML validated.

title: Witness since/until filtering uses lexicographic timestamp comparison
description:
lock witness query/count currently compare RFC3339 timestamps as raw strings in matches_filters (src/witness/mod.rs), which can produce incorrect results when records or filter values use non-Z offsets.

Repro:
1. Put two records in a witness ledger: ts=2026-01-01T00:00:00+02:00 and ts=2025-12-31T22:30:00Z.
2. Run: lock witness query --since 2025-12-31T22:45:00Z --json.
3. Expected: +02:00 record excluded based on absolute time; actual behavior may differ due to string compare.

Impact:
- User-facing correctness bug in witness query/count filtering.
- Misleading counts/results for mixed-offset ledgers, affecting audits/debugging.

Proposed fix scope:
- Parse filter and record timestamps with chrono::DateTime::parse_from_rfc3339 and compare normalized instants.
- Define fallback behavior for unparsable timestamps and cover with tests.
- Add mixed-offset and malformed-timestamp test cases.

title: Release parity: automate Homebrew tap updates for lock
description:
Add a post-release automation step that updates cmdrvl/homebrew-tap for lock artifacts.

Design:
- Download release SHA256SUMS for the lock version.
- Generate/update lock formula with platform-specific URLs + checksums.
- Commit and push formula updates to tap repo using release automation token.

Acceptance criteria:
- Homebrew formula update is automated in release pipeline.
- Formula checksums match published release artifacts.
- No-op behavior when formula content is unchanged.
close_reason:
Homebrew tap automation added to release workflow:
1. Downloads SHA256SUMS from GitHub release
2. Generates platform-specific formula (macos arm/intel, linux x86_64/aarch64)
3. Pushes to cmdrvl/homebrew-tap via HOMEBREW_TAP_TOKEN secret
4. No-op when formula content unchanged (git diff --quiet)
5. Graceful skip when TAP_TOKEN not configured
YAML validated.
